edu.stanford.math.plex4.graph

Interface AbstractUndirectedGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.pair.IntIntPair>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AbstractWeightedUndirectedGraph
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UndirectedListGraph, UndirectedWeightedListGraph

    public interface AbstractUndirectedGraph
extends java.lang.Iterable<edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.pair.IntIntPair>, java.io.Serializable
    This interface abstracts the functionality of an unweighted graph. The graph must be undirected. The vertices of the graph are labeled {0, ..., n - 1}, where n is the number of vertices.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      This function returns the set of neighbors of vertex i in the graph which have indices less than i.

      java.util.Iterator<edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.pair.IntIntPair> iterator()
      This function returns an edge iterator that allows the user to iterate over the set of edges in the graph.

      This function removes the edge (i, j) from the graph.

      • getLowerNeighbors

        gnu.trove.TIntHashSet getLowerNeighbors(int i)
        This function returns the set of neighbors of vertex i in the graph which have indices less than i.
        Parameters:
        i - the vertex to query
        Returns:
        the set of j such that j < i and i ~ j
